title: BCB targets journalists, imposes restrictions after T20 World Cup snub
description: The BCB has introduced strict entry rules for journalists at the Sher-e-Bangla National Cricket Stadium due to increased security measures amid controversy over Bangladesh’s T20 World Cup participation. Media must use Gate 1 and can enter only on match days, press events, or approved sessions. The move follows the ICC’s decision to replace Bangladesh with Scotland for the 2026 T20 World Cup starting February 7.

title: ‘Homeland or death’: Cuban President Miguel Diaz hits back at US tariff threat on oil suppliers
description: Cuba's President Miguel Diaz-Canel strongly criticizes the United States for threatening tariffs on oil suppliers. He states the move aims to choke the Cuban economy. Diaz-Canel accuses the US of using force and dictating trade partners. Cuba vows to respond with firmness and confidence. The US order labels Cuba a threat, citing support for hostile entities.

Budget 2026: What five years of data reveal about India’s direct and indirect taxes - explained
description: As Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman prepares the Union Budget 2026-27, tax data reveals a significant shift. Direct tax collections have surged, surpassing indirect taxes as the government's primary revenue source. This trend highlights a growing reliance on income and profit-based taxation, impacting fiscal strategy and taxpayer compliance.

Deep Brain Stimulation Surgery: Retiree finds relief from dystonia; procedure done in Gurugram
description: A man's debilitating struggle with cervical dystonia, a neurological disorder causing severe neck pain and involuntary muscle contractions, found a life-changing solution. After years of ineffective treatments, Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS) surgery, often called a "brain pacemaker," offered him remarkable relief, restoring his quality of life and eliminating chronic pain within days.

'Trashy ruminations of a convicted criminal': MEA rubbishes reference to PM Modi in Epstein files
description: India's Ministry of External Affairs has vehemently dismissed claims linking Prime Minister Narendra Modi to Jeffrey Epstein's leaked documents.  The ministry labelled the references as "trashy ruminations" from a convicted criminal, urging their immediate rejection. These statements follow the US Department of Justice's release of extensive materials related to the late financier.

title: IMF data puts India ahead of US in 2026 global real GDP growth; Elon Musk responds
description: India is set to lead global economic growth by 2026, surpassing the US, according to IMF data. Elon Musk highlighted this seismic shift, noting India and China will drive over 43% of worldwide expansion. This surge, fueled by domestic strength and manufacturing, signals a changing global economic landscape beyond traditional Western markets.

Turning Point USA announces platforms for rival Super Bowl halftime show
description: After months of silence, Turning Point USA has finally confirmed how fans can watch its alternative Super Bowl LX halftime show. The broadcast will stream on YouTube, X, Rumble, and several conservative TV networks. While distribution details are now clear, Turning Point USA has not revealed performers or production plans, which still leaves viewers with the question of what they will see when they tune in.

title: Gold, silver price crash: $5 trillion lost in market cap; what led to the fall
description: Gold prices dropped by a whopping Rs 14,000 per 10 grams and silver prices tanked by Rs 20,000 per kg in Delhi on Friday. The sharp dip came after gold hit a fresh high of Rs 1,83,000 and silver of Rs 4,04,500 on Thursday.

New details in Ryan Wedding case as FBI links wife, associates to drug killings
description: Former Olympic snowboarder Ryan Wedding has pleaded not guilty to federal charges tied to drug trafficking and murder. US authorities say he led a billion-dollar drug ring uncovered through Operation Giant Slalom. Several alleged associates, including his wife, girlfriend, lawyer, and international partners, have been sanctioned, arrested, or face extradition, according to the FBI and US Department of Justice.

title: Vastu rituals for positive energy: Offer flowers, kheer, coconut, incense
description: Discover Vastu Shastra hacks to invite positive cosmic flow and prosperity into your home. Simple offerings like fresh flowers, sweet milk rice, coconuts with tilak, and incense can remove negativity, attract divine grace, and ensure peace and harmony. These rituals are believed to ward off the evil eye and open new avenues for happiness and wealth.

Nvidia H-1B data reveals US pay as Jensen Huang reviews all compensation
description: Nvidia's soaring stock has created millionaires among its employees, with H-1B visa filings revealing substantial base salaries for critical roles. While CEO Jensen Huang emphasizes personal involvement in compensation, earlier hires have significantly benefited from equity appreciation. The data offers a glimpse into the pay for engineers, architects, researchers, and product managers, excluding bonuses and equity.

title: The world’s first handheld scientific calculator
description: On February 1, 1972 — just a day before a year was completed from the official go-ahead for the product — HP-35 was made available to the world. Now recognised as the world’s first scientific pocket calculator, the gadget revolutionised the way we looked at handheld equipment. A.S.Ganesh punches some keys to give you the tale of these number crunchers…

title: Gabrielle Union breaks silence on fertility issues with Dwyane Wade
description: Dwyane Wade and his wife, the popular actress Gabrielle Union, have had a beautiful and a healthy marriage ever since they tied the knot in 2014 after dating for a couple of years. While both Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union had been through divorce before, the popular actress did not have a biological child of her own unlike the NBA legend. As the two tried to expand their family, Gabrielle Union details the trauma she faced as she failed to conceive.

title: Google cofounder makes biggest-ever public donation to tackle California housing crisis
description: Google co-founder Sergey Brin has made his largest public donation, contributing $20 million to a new coalition tackling California's housing crisis. This significant move, backed by other tech leaders, comes as the state's wealthy face a potential wealth tax. Brin's philanthropy has been substantial, with billions donated to various causes, including climate solutions and medical research.
